pull.title: test: XORed blocks test follow up
pull.body:
Builds on PR #30657.

Refactors `read_xor_key()` from `util.py` to `test_node.py` and renames to `blocks_key` (comment https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30657#discussion_r1723358327)

Adds a check that `xor.dat` is created when missing (comment https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30657#discussion_r1717724161)

Help states:
```
-blocksxor
       Whether an XOR-key applies to blocksdir *.dat files. The created XOR-key
       will be zeros for an existing blocksdir or when `-blocksxor=0` is
       set, and random for a freshly initialized blocksdir. (default: 1)
```

test: check xor.dat recreated when missing

events.message: test: check xor.dat recreated when missing

events.body:
> If you want, you could also tackle the suggestion to move the `read_xor_key` helper to the `TestNode` class, see [#30657 (comment)](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30657#discussion_r1717985952)

Thanks for the suggestion!  This PR seems to be a reasonable place to perform the move, so I updated it to include this. Happy to make tweaks if you or @maflcko have any further suggestions.

rename.from: test: check xor.dat creation when missing
rename.to: test: XORed blocks test follow up

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -59,6 +60,8 @@ def run_test(self):
         # checklevel=2 -> verify block validity + undo data
         # nblocks=0    -> verify all blocks
         node.verifychain(checklevel=2, nblocks=0)
+        self.log.info("Check that xor.dat is recreated")
+        assert read_xor_key(node=node) == NULL_BLK_XOR_KEY

@@ -59,6 +60,8 @@ def run_test(self):
         # checklevel=2 -> verify block validity + undo data
         # nblocks=0    -> verify all blocks
         node.verifychain(checklevel=2, nblocks=0)
+        self.log.info("Check that xor.dat is recreated")
+        assert read_xor_key(node=node) == NULL_BLK_XOR_KEY

@@ -391,6 +391,8 @@ def rpc_url(datadir, i, chain, rpchost):
 # The size of the blocks xor key,
 # from InitBlockdirXorKey::xor_key.size()
 NUM_XOR_BYTES = 8
+# The null block key (all 0s)
+NULL_BLK_XOR_KEY = bytes(NUM_XOR_BYTES)
comments.body:
nit, personally I prefer to be explicit about the zeroes initialization, but no big deal
```suggestion
NULL_BLK_XOR_KEY = bytes([0] * NUM_XOR_BYTES)
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -391,6 +391,8 @@ def rpc_url(datadir, i, chain, rpchost):
 # The size of the blocks xor key,
 # from InitBlockdirXorKey::xor_key.size()
 NUM_XOR_BYTES = 8
+# The null block key (all 0s)
+NULL_BLK_XOR_KEY = bytes(NUM_XOR_BYTES)

@@ -469,6 +469,12 @@ def blocks_path(self) -> Path:
     def blocks_key_path(self) -> Path:
         return self.blocks_path / "xor.dat"
 
+    @property
+    def read_xor_key(self) -> bytes:
+        with open(self.blocks_key_path, "rb") as xor_f:
+            NUM_XOR_BYTES = 8 # From InitBlocksdirXorKey::xor_key.size()
+            return xor_f.read(NUM_XOR_BYTES)
comments.body: Not sure if there are guidelines for this (and if yes, how strict we are), but I would tend to avoid using the "property" decorator for non-trivial methods that access state outside of the class (in this case, by interacting with the file system). At least I wouldn't expect as user that accessing a class field ever involves any I/O. I think dropping the property and keeping the name as-is "read_xor_key" might be just fine?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -54,7 +53,7 @@ def run_test(self):
             match=ErrorMatch.PARTIAL_REGEX)
 
         self.log.info("Delete XOR key, restart node with '-blocksxor=0', check blk*.dat/rev*.dat file integrity")
-        os.remove(node.blocks_path / 'xor.dat')
+        os.remove(node.blocks_key_path)
comments.body: nit: could put this already into the commit that introduces the blocks_key_path property to TestNode.
